Body:
I took my laptop as a device to publish some data to the IoT Cloud Foundation, we are getting the state as connected and disconnected.(Fluctuating) But we are unable to see ant sort of data in the dashboard. We are trying to Publih some message or json data to the IOT Foundation Cloud but it is not working for me.

Can we do in this way or not. I already connected Raspberr Pi and BeagleBone Devices to the IoT Foumdation Cloud.

Please Help me on this.

we are trying to connect as a device and publish sample JSON Data as an event to view in IoT Foundation Dashboard.		 client.on('connect', function() {		  console.log('MQTT client connected to IBM IoT Cloud.');	var data = {	                   d": {	                     "name" : 1

Log Data- 	Message	Timestamp	Closed connection from 10.106.90.227. [CONNECT must be the first message in a connection.] [17] times in the last [5] minutes	Jan 20, 2016 11:04:35 AM	Closed connection from 182.72.208.42. [CONNECT must be the first message in a connection.] [17] times in the last [5] minutes	Jan 20, 2016 11:04:35 AM	Token auth succeeded: ClientID='d:r9dk5y:my:3C-97-0E-E3-C9-38'	Jan 20, 2016 11:04:35 AM	Token auth succeeded: ClientID='d:r9dk5y:my:3C-97-0E-E3-C9-38'	Jan 20, 2016 11:04:32 AM	Token auth succeeded: ClientID='d:r9dk5y:my:3C-97-0E-E3-C9-38'	Jan 20, 2016 11:04:04 AM
Can you please share any log output as well as relevant code? You can use a laptop as a device though

Please provide details about what information you are trying to publish and how you are connecting.  Are you trying to connect as an application and publish as a device?  Or are you actually trying to connect as a device and pubilsh some events?
Are you using a value of use-token-auth for the username for authentication?   Refer to MQTT device authentication information  https://docs.internetofthings.ibmcloud.com/messaging/devices.html
